name: cursor-agents
title: Cursor Agents
description: Create and manage background agents that work on your repositories
author: thomas

commands.name: launch-agent
commands.title: Launch Agent
commands.subtitle: Cursor Agents
commands.description: Start a new background agent to work on your repository.

commands.name: list-agents
commands.title: List Agents
commands.subtitle: Cursor Agents
commands.description: Check all your background agents from anywhere.

commands.name: menu-bar
commands.title: Menu Bar Overview
commands.subtitle: Cursor Agents
commands.description: Check all your background agents from your menu bar.

tools.name: launch-agent
tools.title: Launch Agent
tools.description: Launches a background agent to work on repository

prompt.description:
The task or instructions for the agent to execute.

@example "Write a blog post about the latest trends in AI"

repository.description:
The repository to work on, must be a GitHub url, e.g. https://github.com/raycast/extensions

@remarks Use the `get-repositories` tool to get the list of all available repositories.

ref.description: The Git ref (branch/tag) to use as the base branch, e.g. "main" or "v1.0.0". If not specified uses default branch of the repository.

tools.name: get-repositories
tools.title: Get Repositories
tools.description: Returns all available repositories configured by the user
tools.instructions:
Returns all available repositories that the user has configured in Cursor Agents.
This can be used to determine which repository the user might be referring to.

tools.name: add-repository
tools.title: Add Repository
tools.description: Adds a new GitHub repository to the user's configured repositories
tools.instructions:
Adds a new repository to the user's configured repositories list.
The repository can then be used with the launch-agent tool.

url.description:
The GitHub repository URL to add, e.g. https://github.com/raycast/extensions

@example "https://github.com/raycast/extensions"

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
